P.title: Will Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extra terrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled.
Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.

P.title: Will Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extra terrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled.
Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.

not_P.title: Will Europa not be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045?
not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if humanity does not discover convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 or if it does so after detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this question will resolve as Yes. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled.
Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.

para_P.title: Could Europa be the initial location where humanity identifies extraterrestrial life, assuming it is discovered prior to 2045?
para_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if humanity uncovers credible proof of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and does so prior to finding extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the cosmos. Should convincing evidence of extraterrestrial life be discovered elsewhere before that time on Europa, this question will be marked as negative. If no extraterrestrial life is identified before 2045, this question will be considered Annulled.
Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) currently alive and (b) highly improbable to be a result of contamination from Earth spacecraft. This allows for the possibility of life that may have been transported from Earth through other non-human-engineered means.

Q.title: Will we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen atmosphere before 2030?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of extraterrestrial life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and (2) We detect an exoplanet atmosphere with more than 5% oxygen before January 1, 2030?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe, and (2) any exoplanet with more than 5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030. If either of these conditions is not met, this question will resolve as No.

(2) Any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030.

If either of these conditions is not met, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, the question regarding Europa will be Annulled.

Q.title: Will we find life on Mars by 2050?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions.
If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this question will resolve as No

P.title: Will US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question

A formal announcement from any of these organizations will be adequate to resolve this query.

Q.title: Will any OECD country achieve a 10% or greater reduction in the national rate of obesity for 3 consecutive years before 2030?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
According to the OECD's 2017 Obesity Update (PDF), more than one in two adults and nearly one in six children are overweight or obese in the OECD area. The obesity epidemic spread further in the five years leading up to 2017, although at a slower pace than before. Despite this, projections show a continuing increase of obesity in all OECD countries.
A nearly tenfold variation in obesity rates can be seen across OECD countries; as of 2016, in Japan the rate of obesity was just 4.2%, while in the US it was 40%. (See a graphic on this page for full OECD obesity rates).
This question asks: Will any OECD country achieve a 10% or greater proportional reduction in the national rate of obesity, as compared to levels reported by the OECD for 2016, for three consecutive years before 1 January 2030?
Resolution should cite a data release (from either the OECD itself or any of its 36 member states) that demonstrates that the national obesity rate of any OECD member country has fallen by 10% or more from 2016 levels for three consecutive years before 2030.
This question refers to the percentage of the total adult population (aged 15 years and over) considered obese. Note that we're looking for a 10% proportional drop (e.g. if the initial percentage is 20%, we'd be looking for a fall to 18%; if it were 40%, we would be looking for a drop to 36%).
In the event of a positive resolution, the question should close retroactively one day prior to the release of information that causes the positive resolution.
If one year goes unreported for a country, the years on each side are still considered consecutive. If the gap is greater than one year, the years on each side are not considered consecutive.
Changelog:
2020-09-17: added requirement for consecutive years, to mitigate noisy data. See this thread.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040 (2) any OECD country achieve a 10% or greater reduction in the national rate of obesity for 3 consecutive years before 2030?

Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) At any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question. (2) Any OECD country achieves a 10% or greater proportional reduction in the national rate of obesity, as compared to levels reported by the OECD for 2016, for three consecutive years before 1 January 2030. Resolution should cite a data release (from either the OECD itself or any of its 36 member states) that demonstrates that the national obesity rate of any OECD member country has fallen by 10% or more from 2016 levels for three consecutive years before 2030.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) any OECD country achieve a 10% or greater reduction in the national rate of obesity for three consecutive years before 2030, and (2) US life expectancy at birth for both sexes not fall below 75 years before 2040?

P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs: (1) At any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question. (2) Any OECD country achieves a 10% or greater proportional reduction in the national rate of obesity, as compared to levels reported by the OECD for 2016, for three consecutive years before 1 January 2030, with resolution citing a data release that demonstrates the national obesity rate of any OECD member country has fallen by 10% or more from 2016 levels for three consecutive years.

Q_given_P.title: Given that US life expectancy at birth for both sexes falls below 75 years before 2040, will any OECD country achieve a 10% or greater reduction in the national rate of obesity for 3 consecutive years before 2030?
Q_given_P.body: Suppose the following is true: Between January 1, 2020, and January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. Then, will any OECD country achieve a 10% or greater proportional reduction in the national rate of obesity, as compared to levels reported by the OECD for 2016, for three consecutive years before January 1, 2030? Resolution Criteria for Q: Resolution should cite a data release (from either the OECD itself or any of its 36 member states) that demonstrates that the national obesity rate of any OECD member country has fallen by 10% or more from 2016 levels for three consecutive years before 2030.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040; (2) any OECD country achieve a 10% or greater reduction in the national rate of obesity for 3 consecutive years before 2030?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) At any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve this part of the question. (2) Any OECD country achieves a 10% or greater proportional reduction in the national rate of obesity, as compared to levels reported by the OECD for 2016, for three consecutive years before January 1, 2030. Resolution should cite a data release that demonstrates this reduction for a member country.

Q.title: Will there be a global thermonuclear war by 2070?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if there is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory
Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
These conditions are chosen to set aside a two-party regional nuclear war, say between India and Pakistan, or Israel and an adversary, or the UK and France, as disastrous as that would be.
As with many questions with a positive-resolution condition that may preclude being awarded points on Metaculus, predictors are enjoined to predict in good faith, as points will not be awarded until 2070 anyway

para_P.title: Is a global thermonuclear conflict expected to occur by 2070?
para_P.body:
Criteria for Resolution
This inquiry will conclude affirmatively if there is a military confrontation prior to January 1, 2070, in which at least one of the following scenarios is met:
Three nations each set off a minimum of 10 nuclear weapons with a yield of at least 10 kilotons beyond their own borders.
Two nations each unleash a minimum of 50 nuclear weapons with a yield of at least 10 kilotons outside of their own territory.
These scenarios are specifically defined to exclude a bilateral regional nuclear conflict, such as one between India and Pakistan, or Israel and another nation, or the UK and France, despite the catastrophic nature of such events.
As with numerous questions that have a positive resolution criterion that might prevent points being awarded on Metaculus, participants are encouraged to predict earnestly, as points will not be granted until the year 2070 regardless.

Q.title: Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.
(Note that 1880 isn't exactly pre-industrial, but earlier data is highly unreliable, and there should really not have been much warming by then.)
Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible. Note that the data in the link is normalised relative to the 1951-1980 baseline, on which 1880 stands at -0.2. Therefore, the critical value to look for with this specific NASA dataset will be 1.8 ˚C. It is likely, though, that the link will no longer be active in a few decades, so a different dataset may have to be used anyway.
The last possible set of 5 years to satisfy the requirement would be 2095-2099, so the last possible resolution date would be around mid-2100, in order to make sure that there are no uncertainties regarding the 2099 climate data

P.title: Will there be a "World War Three" before 2050?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050, both of these conditions are true:
There is a military conflict involving countries representing in totality at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing.
At least 10 million people (civillians or military personnel) have been killed in the conflict.
[see edit history in the fine print]
Fine Print
PPP will may be determined from the following sources, in order of precedence:
IMF
World Bank
United Nations
CIA
[2022-03-24]: Edited to clarify that "world GDP" will be determined in PPP for condition 1 .
[2021-11-24]: Edited to clarify the time constraints.
(Edit 1/16/19 to remove third "described as WWIII" criterion.)

Q.title: Will there be a major famine in North Korea before 2025?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes in the event that before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. The question will resolve as No if this does not occur

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) There is a "World War Three" before 2050, and (2) there is a major famine in North Korea before 2025?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050, both of the following conditions are true:
1. There is a military conflict involving countries representing in totality at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing, and at least 10 million people (civilians or military personnel) have been killed in the conflict (this defines "World War Three").
2. Before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020, that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths.
The question will resolve as No if either of these conditions is not met.

P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs:
1. There is a "World War Three" before 2050, which will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050, both of these conditions are true:
   - There is a military conflict involving countries representing in totality at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing.
   - At least 10 million people (civilians or military personnel) have been killed in the conflict.
2. There is a major famine in North Korea before 2025, which will resolve as Yes if before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. 
This question will resolve as No if neither of these events occurs.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) There will be a major famine in North Korea before 2025, and (2) There will be no "World War Three" before 2050?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths, and (2) At any time between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050, at least one of these conditions is false: there is not a military conflict involving countries representing in totality at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing; fewer than 10 million people (civilians or military personnel) have been killed in the conflict.

Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following conditions are met:
1. For the first condition, at any time between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050, there is a military conflict involving countries representing in totality at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing, and at least 10 million people (civilians or military personnel) have been killed in the conflict.
2. For the second condition, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths before January 1, 2025. 
The question will resolve as No if neither condition occurs.

Resolution Criteria for World War Three: This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050, both of these conditions are true: There is a military conflict involving countries representing in totality at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing. At least 10 million people (civilians or military personnel) have been killed in the conflict.

Resolution Criteria for Major Famine in North Korea: This question will resolve as Yes in the event that before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. The question will resolve as No if this does not occur.

P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050, both of the following conditions are true:

2. Before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths.

Q.title: Will the price of water on the NQH20 hit $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if the price of water hits $2500, adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD, on the NQH20 by 2050-01-01, 00:00 UTC. This question resolves negatively if the price of water does not hit $2500 by that date, and it resolves ambiguously if the NQH20 or a similar exchange doesn't continuously track California water prices up until 2050

Q.title: Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.
(Note that 1880 isn't exactly pre-industrial, but earlier data is highly unreliable, and there should really not have been much warming by then.)
Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible. Note that the data in the link is normalised relative to the 1951-1980 baseline, on which 1880 stands at -0.2. Therefore, the critical value to look for with this specific NASA dataset will be 1.8 ˚C. It is likely, though, that the link will no longer be active in a few decades, so a different dataset may have to be used anyway.
The last possible set of 5 years to satisfy the requirement would be 2095-2099, so the last possible resolution date would be around mid-2100, in order to make sure that there are no uncertainties regarding the 2099 climate data

The price question resolves negatively if the price of water does not hit $2500 by that date, and the global warming question resolves positively if the temperature criteria are met as described, with data ideally sourced from NASA.
